intro: Actinea biternata, commonly known as the three-leaved actinia, is a species of flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its triangular, three-lobed leaves that are typically arranged oppositely along the stem. Its small, clustered flowers are usually greenish-white in color and appear in late spring to early summer. Actinea biternata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streambanks.
